newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sanyo develops large, no glasses 3D display.
newsitem.headline: Sanyo develops large, no glasses 3D display.

text.p: Japanese electronics firm Sanyo Electric Co. Ltd. said Thursday it developed a 15-inch, high-resolution three-dimensional display for which users do not need to wear special glasses.

The screen, which Sanyo said is larger than previous 3D displays that do not require glasses, includes a sensor that detects the position of the viewer's head and adjusts images automatically for the left and right eyes.
The display is an XGA resolution, liquid crystal display with 1,024 by 768 pixels, Sanyo said.
"This allows the viewer an unprecedented range of motion, thus expanding the scope of 3D viewing," Sanyo said, adding that the display also offered more realistic images.
The display can be used with workstations and personal computers, and will also be used in surgical and diagnostic medical equipment, games and driving and flight simulations, Sanyo said.

Sanyo, which said it developed the world's first 3D display that does not require glasses in 1994, has already marketed four-, six- and 10-inch displays for commercial, medical and entertainment uses.
